metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36323 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, there is an optimization for joining strings that can cause uninitialized bytes to be exposed (or the program to crash) if the borrowed string changes after its length is checked.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.67 - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-all - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-clippy - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-gdb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-lldb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-src - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustc - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustfmt - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2').
